img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled COVID-19 Information

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px;

img.p:
This is a reminder that there will be no meals for pickup on Friday, April 10th. Meal service will resume normal
schedule on Monday, April 13th.
Elementary instructional packet distribution will resume on Tuesday, April 14th, from 8:30 AM to 9:30 AM.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

div.style: display: inline; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px;

span.br:
Library books for all Sonora ISD campuses need to be dropped off at the Elementary on Tuesday, April 14th, from 8:30 AM to 9:30 AM. Thank you.
UPDATE: April 3rd:

span.style: font-size: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant-ligatures: inherit; font-variant-caps: inherit; font-weight: inherit; background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); font-family: inherit; color: inherit;
span.br: The following is a link from the Texas Health and Human Services Commission for Individuals experiencing anxiety, stress, or emotional challenges due to the COVID-19 pandemic:

span.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; font: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; color: inherit;

p.span: People needing support can also call their Statewide COVID-19 Mental Health Support Line 24 hours a day, 7 days a week toll-free at833-986-1919.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

span.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; font: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; color: inherit;

span.br:
UPDATE: March 31st:
Sonora ISD will be closed with Instruction thru Friday May the 1st. Instructional packets and meal distribution will remain on the current schedule. Please continue to check our Facebook page and website for updates. Thank you.
UPDATE: March 26th:

span.style: font-size: medium; background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); font-family: Arial; color: rgb(32, 31, 30);
span.br: Sonora ISD will be closed through April third. We will continue to get updates and will make announcements as needed. Procedures and schedules for homework packets and meal distribution will remain the same for next week. Please continue to check our website and Facebook page for updates or changes. Thank you.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

span.span: For students receiving occupational therapy, physical therapy, or speech therapy services through the Sonora ISD Special Programs Department, your individualized therapy packets will be available for pickup Monday morning from 9:00 am to 12:00 pm. The therapists have begun contacting families directly to set up weekly phone or video conference sessions. Thank you all for your patience; they have spent a lot of time collecting individualized resources for each student.

br.span: Here are some helpful instructions for using Zoom.

On March 19th we posted on Facebook that Sonora will begin delivering meals to those students that needed them on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday each week that we are doing our home-based learning. We attached a short survey and asked you to fill it out and submit. Currently, only 17 people have responded to the survey.

We do not want any of our students to be hungry during this difficult time and we understand that parents/guardians might not be able to get off work and pick them up. So here is an old-fashioned way to request having meals delivered to your door for any child ages 2 years through 18 years old. You can answer the following questions and email them to sean.leamon@sonoraisd.net or find the survey monkey questionnaire on Facebook and complete it.
Q1 Do you need meals delivered to your home for your children?
Q2 Please provide your name for contact.
Q3 How many children (ages 2-18 years) live in your household?
Q4 Please provide a telephone number where you can be reached.
Q5 Please provide your physical address where meals will be delivered.
Q6 Do you consent to have meals delivered to your home from the school?

span.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

br.span: Sonora ISD teachers and coaches are utilizing Remind to communicate with students and parents during this time. The Remind app can be downloaded for free on smart phones and tablets or you can communicate via text as well. Just follow the texting instructions at the top of the directory. Here is our current directory of Remind accounts by teacher/subject.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: medium;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: medium;

br.p: Parents and students, Sonora High School will be hosting times for your children to virtually meet with their teachers and classmates each week. This is a time that can be used to ask questions, get clarification, or just chat with their peers and teachers. You can join with any device or even with your landline. Teachers will be sending out the information for their meetings to your childs school email address before Monday, March 23rd. The meetings will also be recorded and then posted to the teachers web page and/or Google classroom. This is a new game for all of us, so please be patient as we work to make things the best we possibly can for our students. See schedule link below.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px;

br.br:
UPDATE: March 18th:
SISD will begin Home-Based-Learning tomorrow, March 19ththrough March 27th. We will make a determination on Thursday, March 26thby 12:00 pm, if we are to return to regular school on March 30th.
Parents and students can pick up homework packets from each campus on Thursday, March 19th at the campus specific times designated below.
8:30 9:30 AM and 12:00-1:00 PM for PK-6
Elementary Circle, Concho Street
**Boxed meals (breakfast and lunch) are also available for pick up at the Elementary Circle at the hours listed above. Please note that students must be present in the vehicle.**
8:30 AM 11:30 AM at Middle school for 7th-8th grade
Front of Middle School, 1stStreet
9:00 AM 12:00 PM at High School for 9th-12th
High School Entrance, Tayloe Street

p.style: color: rgb(32, 31, 30); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; margin: 0px;

span.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-size: 16pt; line-height: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; font-family: Papyrus; color: inherit;

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px;

br.br:
UPDATE: March 16th:
Please read the information provided in the letter below for additional information regarding coronavirus provided by Mr. Aschenbeck.
Letter from Mr. Aschenbeck
UPDATE: March 15th:
Sonora ISD is canceling classes and all school activities from March 16th through March 20th. Please refer to the SISD Facebook and web page for more information.
COVID-19 Update (March 13th):

p.style: margin: 6px 0px 0px; display: inline; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px;

br.p:
Sonora ISD is actively monitoring the coronavirus situation. As of right now we are on regular schedule for Monday, March 16th. In the meantime we want everyone to continue to wash their hands regularly. Our schools have been disinfected using the Clorox 360 machines and we will continue to disinfect on a regular schedule. If we discover any confirmed cases of the coronavirus in our area, we will then make a decision on closing the schools. We will continue to use Facebook, Twitter, and our call home system as needed. Everyday we will be getting updates from the Commissioner of Education through a telephone conference call.
Information from Representative Andrew Murr
